result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas W Krah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant Nicholas W Krah in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Nicholas W Krah.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Oswald gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Vruwink argues his sentencing recommendation to the court. Defendant makes a statement to the court regarding sentencing.

Not guilty plea. Bond is continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
09:24 AM Defendant Nicholas W Krah in court.  Nathan T. Oswald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant now appears. Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He is not eligible for Public Defender and will be applying for court-appointed counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Scott Killian is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Oswald. On 12/30/21, he conducted a traffic stop in the City of Wisconsin Rapids. The driver was identified by his driver's license. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He was given consent to search the vehicle. A wallet was found with defendant's ID and a white crystalline substance. He suspected that the substance was methamphetamine. Defendant admitted that it was methamphetamine. He tested the substance and it did test positive for methamphetamine.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:20 AM Defendant Nicholas W Krah in court.  Nathan T. Oswald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests warrant.
Court orders warrant. No bond.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:23 AM Defendant Nicholas W Krah in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Transferred to Branch 3 for preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety.   No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
